intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. subdepilaticeps, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often glabrous or nearly so. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and are surrounded by bracts. This subspecies is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
